text: A Tánaiste (plural: Tánaistí) is the deputy head of the government of the Republic of Ireland. The Taoiseach nominates a member of Government to be Tánaiste. Simon Harris is the current Tánaiste. Under the Irish Free State, the deputy leader was Deputy President of the Executive Council. In 1937 the title was changed to Tánaiste In history, the tánaiste was the heir of the chief (taoiseach) or king (rí). Category:Politics of Ireland
title: Tánaiste
